articles.title: EU Commission Chief Suggests NATO Could Target Russian Aircraft
articles.summary: European Commission President **Ursula von der Leyen** sparked controversy by suggesting NATO countries might consider shooting down **Russian** aircraft violating airspace, following similar comments from **US President Trump**. The statement raises tensions amid ongoing regional conflicts.

articles.title: Amazon Agrees to Pay Record FTC Fine Over Prime Subscriptions
articles.summary: E-commerce giant **Amazon** has agreed to pay a historic **$2.5 billion** settlement to the **Federal Trade Commission** over allegations of misleading Prime subscription practices and making cancellation deliberately difficult for consumers.

articles.title: Trump Shifts Russia Stance Following Ukraine Military Strategy Briefing
articles.summary: Former skeptic **Donald Trump** has altered his position on **Russia** after receiving detailed intelligence about **Ukraine's** planned offensive operations. The shift comes ahead of crucial meetings with **President Zelensky**.

articles.title: China Announces Historic Commitment to Reduce Greenhouse Gas Emissions
articles.summary: **President Xi Jinping** announced **China's** first absolute emissions reduction target, pledging to cut greenhouse gases by **7-10%** by **2035**. This landmark decision from the world's largest carbon emitter signals a major shift in climate policy.

articles.title: Breakthrough Gene Therapy Shows Promise in Huntington's Disease Treatment
articles.summary: **UniQure** has announced promising results from their **Phase 1/2** study of a revolutionary gene therapy treatment for **Huntington's disease**. The experimental treatment demonstrated significant success in slowing disease progression.

articles.title: Armed Attack at Dallas Immigration Office Reveals Anti-ICE Message
articles.summary: A gunman targeted a **Dallas ICE** field office in a fatal attack, with investigators discovering anti-immigration messages written on ammunition. The incident occurred at a facility responsible for processing recent detainees.

articles.title: Violence Erupts in Ladakh as Statehood Protests Turn Deadly
articles.summary: Authorities imposed curfew in **Leh** after violent protests left **four dead** and **80 injured**. The **Leh Apex Body's** demonstration for statehood escalated into widespread clashes, leading to **50** arrests.

articles.title: Meta's Threads Surpasses X in Daily Active Users
articles.summary: **Meta's** social platform **Threads** has overtaken **Elon Musk's X** in daily active mobile users, marking a significant shift in social media dynamics. The **two-year-old** platform's growth reflects changing user preferences.

articles.title: Patriots Owner Sells Minority Stake in Historic NFL Deal
articles.summary: **Robert Kraft** has agreed to sell **8%** of the **New England Patriots** in a landmark deal valuing the franchise at **$9 billion**. The sale represents a remarkable return on his **1994** investment of $172 million.

articles.title: European Navies Join Forces to Protect Gaza Aid Ships
articles.summary: **Italy** and **Spain** have dispatched warships to protect the **Global Sumud Flotilla** delivering aid to **Gaza** following drone attacks near **Greece**. The naval deployment aims to ensure humanitarian assistance reaches its destination.

dailyGreeting: Good morning! Historic climate and medical breakthroughs ahead.

historicalEvents.description: Spanish explorer Balboa first European to see Pacific Ocean
US Congress proposes Bill of Rights amendments
US Congress establishes Sequoia National Park
Central High School in Arkansas integrated despite protests
